challenges.title: ** Commit to not solve other students problems - Advanced JavaScript
description:
Computer programming requires excellent problem solving skills.

Working through problems with the help of documentation is a daily activity for all programmers.
When students give help it should only be to point out where in the documentation, books or other materials where they can learn about a concept.
Students should never give away a solution to a problem or share code that completes a problem.
If a student is still unable to solve a problem, please, refer them to the tutor.
If you and the other student(s) have finished and passed off the project or challenge feel free to discuss, share techniques and source code.
However, please do not discuss within earshot of other students that have not passed off to that point.
By clicking below you commit to not solve other students problems, share code or give away answers.

challenges.title: Animate World UI
description: Create a new Animate World UI script to display your Electronic Life world.
Technology Stack: 1. Use only HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and DOM, do NOT use any libraries.
The UI can be your own design.
You can use Chapter 7 of Eloquent JavaScript and the previously provided animateworld.js script as a reference.
You should not modify your previous world javascript to make it work with your new animate world javascript, you should only create and modify your new animate world javascript.
Remember to use the Research-Ask method if you get stuck.

challenges.title: Egg Popup
description: Build the Egg Popup as seen in the video bellow.

<video src='http://brickhousecodecamp.org/educationMaterials/projects/workbenchProjects/egg-popup/egg-popup.mp4' style='width:500px;' controls='' preload='auto' poster='http://brickhousecodecamp.org/educationMaterials/projects/workbenchProjects/egg-popup/egg-popup.png'></video>
Technology Stack: 1. Use only HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and DOM, do NOT use any libraries.
The images can be found and linked to here.
Remember to use the Research-Ask method if you get stuck.

challenges.title: Bejeweled
description: Build Bejeweled

Technology Stack: 1. Use only HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and DOM.
You may and are encouraged to use require.js.
Do NOT use any other libraries and do not use images, CSS only for now.

The game board will have the following components:
  • 8 rows and 8 columns
  • a progress bar
  • a score
  • a new game button
Game Rules: We will follow all the rules as defined in the Wikipedia page about bejeweled.
We will ONLY be implementing the Normal Mode.
We will NOT be implementing Time Trial Mode, or game options.
Remember to use the Research-Ask method if you get stuck.
